Often using his camera as a prop to sneak into festivals, Marcus ultimately comes away with raw and intimate footage that impresses even his world famous subjects. Marcus puts his future Ã¢â‚¬â€œ and his love Ã¢â‚¬â€œ on the line for a chance to tour with Mumford & Sons, leaving the only place heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s ever called home and embarking on a cross country road trip. As Ted Dwane, Bassist for Mumford & Sons, puts it Ã¢â‚¬Å“the access and perspective he is so hungry for is what makes his images so unique and compelling and the force that propels this behavior is deep within him and pure.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ It is indeed this drive that makes his quest so innocently unadulterated, separating him from the others, and allowing him in when he really should have been kicked out.
